question: tila respa disclosure rules enforcement timeframes

Enforcement of TILA-RESPA disclosure rules is managed by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), which has the authority to impose penalties for violations. These penalties can include civil penalties, which vary based on the severity of the violation. Additionally, the Federal Reserve Board refers RESPA violations to the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) for consideration of enforcement actions, including the assessment of civil money penalties. ground_truth_answer: Under TILA-RESPA rules, lenders must provide the Loan Estimate within 3 business days of receiving the loan application (the 3/7/3 rule). For the right of rescission, borrowers have 3 business days to cancel after signing the mortgage contract, receiving the TILA disclosure, and receiving two copies of the rescission notice. However, if the TILA disclosure or rescission notice is not received or is inaccurate, the rescission period can extend up to 3 years.
